member.name: T:Moq.Contrib.HttpClient.IHttpMessageHandler
member.summary: An interface to facilitate mocking the protected method.

member.name: M:Moq.Contrib.HttpClient.IHttpMessageHandler.SendAsync(System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Send an HTTP request as an asynchronous operation.
member.param: The HTTP request message to send.
The cancellation token to cancel operation.
member.returns: The task object representing the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Moq.Contrib.HttpClient.MockHttpMessageHandlerExtensions.CreateClient(Moq.Mock{System.Net.Http.HttpMessageHandler})
member.summary: Creates a new backed by this handler.

summary.para: Creates an that returns new instances backed by this handler.
To configure a named client, use to retrieve the mock and add additional setups.

member.name: M:Moq.Contrib.HttpClient.MockHttpMessageHandlerExtensions.Setup``1(Moq.Mock{System.Net.Http.HttpMessageHandler},System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{Moq.Contrib.HttpClient.IHttpMessageHandler,``0}})
member.summary: Specifies a setup on the mocked type for a call to a value-returning method.
member.typeparam: Type of the return value. Typically omitted as it can be inferred from the expression.
member.param: Lambda expression that specifies the expected method invocation.

member.name: M:Moq.Contrib.HttpClient.MockHttpMessageHandlerExtensions.SetupSequence``1(Moq.Mock{System.Net.Http.HttpMessageHandler},System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{Moq.Contrib.HttpClient.IHttpMessageHandler,``0}})
member.summary: Return a sequence of values, one per call.

remarks.para: Moq has two types of sequences:
1. SetupSequence() which creates one setup that returns values in sequence, and 2. InSequence().Setup() which creates multiple setups under When() conditions to ensure that they only match in order
This is the former; the latter is .

member.typeparam: Type of the return value. Typically omitted as it can be inferred from the expression.
member.param: Lambda expression that specifies the expected method invocation.

member.name: M:Moq.Contrib.HttpClient.MockHttpMessageHandlerExtensions.Setup(Moq.Language.ISetupConditionResult{System.Net.Http.HttpMessageHandler},System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{Moq.Contrib.HttpClient.IHttpMessageHandler,System.Threading.Tasks.Task{System.Net.Http.HttpResponseMessage}}})
member.summary: Specifies a conditional setup for by modifying the expression tree similar to , as Moq does not currently support When() conditions or InSequence() in conjunction with Protected().

remarks.para: Moq has two types of sequences:
1. SetupSequence() which creates one setup that returns values in sequence, and 2. InSequence().Setup() which creates multiple setups under When() conditions to ensure that they only match in order
This is the latter; the former is .

member.param: The mock in the context of a When() or InSequence() condition.
A lambda expression in the form of x => x.SendAsync(...).

member.name: M:Moq.Contrib.HttpClient.MockHttpMessageHandlerExtensions.Verify``1(Moq.Mock{System.Net.Http.HttpMessageHandler},System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{Moq.Contrib.HttpClient.IHttpMessageHandler,``0}},System.Nullable{Moq.Times},System.String)
member.summary: Verifies that a specific invocation matching the given expression was performed on the mock. Use in conjunction with the default .
member.typeparam: Type of the return value. Typically omitted as it can be inferred from the expression.
member.param: Lambda expression that specifies the method invocation.
Number of times that the invocation is expected to have occurred. If omitted, assumed to be .
Message to include in the thrown if verification fails.
member.exception: The specified invocation did not occur (or did not occur the specified number of times).

member.name: T:Moq.Contrib.HttpClient.RequestMatcher
member.summary: Custom Moq matchers for using .

members.member:
The methods here are used to automatically generate the RequestExtensions. Summaries must start with "A request matching", and parameters must be on a single line. Verify any changes in the generated code.
A request matching the given predicate.
The predicate used to match the request. is null.

member.name: T:Moq.Contrib.HttpClient.RequestPredicate
member.summary: Memoizes the result of a `match` predicate for a given request to prevent the predicate from being called repeatedly, which may cause it to throw if the request content had been consumed and its stream closed.

member.name: T:Moq.Contrib.HttpClient.ResponseStream
member.summary: A wrapper that maintains its own stream position independent of the underlying stream in order to keep requests from interferring with one another while reusing a stream. Also prevents a disposing from closing the underlying stream. Like a real HttpContentReadStream, this stream is neither seekable nor writable. Requires a seekable stream.
